intro: Halenia hoppii, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds covered in a silky, white fluff. Halenia hoppii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
